title: Winter Squash Ravioli with Butter and Almonds
titleAlternative: Tortelli di Zucca al Burro e Mandorle
introduction: Winter Squash Ravioli with Butter and Almonds brings a touch of sweet to the savory spectrum with the use of butternut or Hubbard squash. This Lombardy and Emilia-Romagna dish is traditionally enhanced with the almond flavor of finely crushed amaretti cookies, adding a unique twist. Toasted almonds bring a delightful crunch to the buttery topping, creating a rich and comforting pasta experience.
ingredients: About 2 pounds butternut or Hubbard squash
1 pound Fresh Egg Pasta, rolled out and cut into 4-inch strips

instructions.instruction: Place a rack in the center of the oven. Preheat the oven to 400Â°F. Oil a small baking pan. Cut the squash in half and scoop out the seeds and fibers. Place the halves cut-side down in the pan. Bake 1 hour or until tender when pierced with a knife. Let cool.

Scrape the flesh away from the skin. Pass the flesh through a food mill fitted with the fine blade or puree it in a food processor or blender. Stir in 3/4 cup of the cheese, the amaretti, egg, nutmeg, and salt. Taste for seasoning.
Prepare the pasta. Make and cook the ravioli as described in the recipe for Cheese Ravioli, steps 2 to 6.

While the ravioli are cooking, melt the butter over medium heat. Pour half of the butter into a warm serving bowl. Add the ravioli and the remaining melted butter. Toss them with almonds. Sprinkle with the remaining 1/2 cup cheese. Serve immediately.
